div.div: Create a public-private key pair and send public key to the server

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 230px; margin-left: 563px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

span.style: font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: center; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; float: none; display: inline !important;

div.span: Creates a public-private key pair, stores its private key and client's public key as a part of the user session.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 350px; margin-left: 303px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.div: Server sends its own public key in response

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 143px; height: 1px; padding-top: 460px; margin-left: 2px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

div.div: Client saves its own private key and server's public key in memory for further communication

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 528px; height: 1px; padding-top: 565px; margin-left: 113px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.div: Now, the client and server can talk in a secure way
